attributes.action: ADHD assessment for children under 6 if they have professionals agreeing
attributes.additional_details: My son is 4, every single person that meets him asks does he have ADHD. Yes suspected is what I respond. Reality is he is being let down. No one will help us as he is only 4! His ADHD symptoms are destroying our lives and there is no help from one anyone. I have to fight and fight just to be heard. School can’t cope, I can’t cope. He needs professional help sooner before he harms himself or someone else. NOT ALL CHILDREN ARE THE SAME WITH SENS NEEDS.
attributes.background: I want parliament and the government to help children with ADHD under 6 years old, to offer then an assessment and access to help and support.

rejection.details:
Decisions about ADHD assessments are a matter for the NHS.

https://www.youngminds.org.uk/parent/parents-a-z-mental-health-guide/adhd/

If you need support with your mental health, you may find the following useful:
 
	- NHS mental health services: https://www.nhs.uk/mental-health/nhs-voluntary-charity-services/nhs-services/how-to-access-mental-health-services/
 
	- Mental health charities and organisations: https://www.nhs.uk/nhs-services/mental-health-services/
